eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.
By default, movement will slow down when going around corners, but this can be changed to always use a constant speed.

Example uses:
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Use constant speed (object will not slow down at corners)
- Use counter-clockwise direction

Tips:
- Set the CenterX and CenterY values to move the object
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangularMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangularMovement

events.comment: Skip if no horizontal movement is desired
Skip if no vertical movement is desired
Skip if no horizontal movement is desired
Skip if no vertical movement is desired
Reset the counter after the rectangular path is completed
Detect when Progress crosses 0 (or if horizontal movement is disabled)
Detect when Progress crosses 0 (or if vertical movement is disabled)
Set the center of movement to the initial location of the object

eventsFunctions.description: Counter used to change the Y position of the object
eventsFunctions.name: ProgressY

eventsFunctions.description: Counter used to change the X position of the object
eventsFunctions.name: ProgressX

eventsFunctions.description: Set center of movement Y position
eventsFunctions.name: SetCenterY
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set center of movement Y position of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Set center of movement X position
eventsFunctions.name: SetCenterX
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set center of movement X position of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Reset progress counters. The object will return to the initial state.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetProgressCounters

propertyDescriptors.label: Horizontal Distance: Amplitude of the movement on X axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: HorizontalDistance

propertyDescriptors.label: Vertical Distance: Amplitude of the movement on Y axis (0 to deactivate)
propertyDescriptors.name: VerticalDistance

propertyDescriptors.label: Counter used to change X position
propertyDescriptors.name: ProgressX

propertyDescriptors.label: Counter used to change Y position
propertyDescriptors.name: ProgressY

propertyDescriptors.label: Use a constant speed for movement
propertyDescriptors.name: ConstantSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
When the action is used, the object(s) will select a random nearby location and begin moving towards it (using the Pathfinding behavior). 

If desired, choose a direction and how closely you want the object to follow it.  This can be used to make objects chase (or run away from) the player, or to make objects cross the screen using a meandering path.

If you keep using the action, once the object reaches a destination, it will select a new random location and begin moving towards it.

If you want to modify the speed of the object, edit the Pathfinding behavior of the object.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Make object travel to random positions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TravelToRandomPositions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make object travel to random positions (with the pathfinding behavior).

eventsFunctions.description: Make object travel to a random position around the object current position. The movement is initiated only when the object is not moving already (its Pathfinding behavior speed is 0).  Move towards a specified angle, if desired.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Make object travel to a random position, with optional direction
eventsFunctions.name: TravelToRandomPositions
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM1_ to random positions, where each stop is at least _PARAM3_px and at most _PARAM4_px from the current position. Move towards angle _PARAM5_ with a biais of _PARAM6_.

events.comment: Only run when the object is not being moved by Pathfinding
Calculate the distance the object will travel
Calculate the maximum difference in degrees allowed from "Direction" based on "DirectionBias"
Select a random direction within the range
Select a direction based on the offset
Calculate position based on direction and distance
Create a new destination every time the object stops

parameters.description: Object that will be travelling (must have Pathfinding behavior)
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Direction (in degrees) the object will move towards (Range: 0-360)
parameters.name: Direction

parameters.longDescription: For example: "0" picks a completely random direction, "0.5" will select a direction within the half-circle that faces the specified direction, and "1" simply uses the specified direction.
parameters.name: DirectionBias

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Health (life points and damages for objects)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Add some damage to the object, decreasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit

parameters.description: Value of the damage to do (will be removed from object health)
parameters.name: DamageValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is considered dead (no more health)
eventsFunctions.name: IsDead

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDamaged

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object, incrasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

parameters.description: How much to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object health to set it to a specific value (check if the actions to damage or heal the object are not better suited to your use case before using this one).
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage cooldown (in seconds) (0 for no cooldown)
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageCooldown
